column1: Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba!////(NB: This review is for brunch-only.) The idea of tapas brunch seems
column3: infelicitous. Portions are awkward while choices are starchy
column4: and so one doesn't know how much to order. Our selections arrived incredibly quickly (or while I or my partner were in the restroom)
column6: were lukewarm at best. The potatoes had that classic
column7: leathery cafeteria potato texture (with a great seasoning). The eggs were all perfectly cooked. The coffee was insipid
column8: and the Bloody Mary buffet was amusingly undersupplied.
